title: Onitsuka Tiger considering India as manufacturing hub for regional growth | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Onitsuka Tiger Considering India as Manufacturing Hub for Regional Growth

Publication Date: N/A Source: Mint

Japanese footwear brand Onitsuka Tiger, part of Asics Corporation, is contemplating India as a potential manufacturing hub to hasten its growth in the region.

“Establishing a manufacturing base in India is a strategic move that can significantly accelerate Onitsuka Tiger’s growth in the region. India’s market potential for premium footwear and apparel is growing rapidly, and setting up local manufacturing will add value,” Ryoji Shoda, vice-president of Onitsuka Tiger.
  • Onitsuka Tiger aims to enhance regional growth through local manufacturing in India.
  • The vice-president noted the rapid growth of India's premium footwear and apparel market.
  • A strategic manufacturing base in India could add significant value to the brand.

The potential establishment of a manufacturing hub in India reflects Onitsuka Tiger's commitment to tapping into one of the fastest-growing markets for premium goods in Asia.
newTitle: Onitsuka Tiger Considering India as Manufacturing Hub for Regional Growth

title: Punjab Bandh LIVE updates: Farmers' call shows impact in Haryana, public transport impacted - Hindustan Times
Samhi Hotels bets on converting old office buildings into luxury hotels | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Samhi Hotels' Innovative Conversion: Transforming Old Offices into Luxury Hotels

Date & Source: November 2022, Live Mint

Samhi Hotels Ltd, in a unique initiative, has leased an empty office building in Hyderabad's Hitech City area to transform it into a 170-175 room luxury hotel under the W Hotel brand, to be managed by Marriott International. This is the first such conversion of an office building into a hotel in the country.

  1. Samhi Hotels is repurposing an empty office building to create a luxury hotel.
  2. The hotel, under the W Hotel brand, is expected to launch by FY27.
  3. This initiative is the first of its kind in India.
Ashish Jakhanwala, chairman, managing director and CEO of Samhi Hotels, claimed that this will be the first-ever initiative of converting an office building into a hotel in the country.

The conversion of office spaces into hotels is a novel approach that could save time and resources compared to building from scratch. This could also open up new opportunities for real estate development and hospitality sectors.
newTitle: Samhi Hotels' Innovative Conversion: Transforming Old Offices into Luxury Hotels

title: Galaxy Z Fold FE, Watch8 Classic in Samsung’s pipeline for 2025 - Sammy Fans
summary:

Date & Source: November 2024, Sammy Fans

Introduction: Samsung is reportedly working on the Galaxy Z Flip FE and Watch8 Classic, which could be unveiled in the latter half of 2025.

  1. The Galaxy Z Flip FE has been listed with the model number SM-F761B, rumored to feature the Exynos 2400 processor.
  2. The Watch8 Classic, model number SM-L505U, is expected to feature a traditional physical rotating bezel.

Conclusion: Samsung fans can expect these devices in the second half of 2025, following the launch of the Galaxy S25 Slim.
newTitle: Samsung's Upcoming Devices: Galaxy Z Flip FE and Watch8 Classic in 2025

title: iPhone SE 4 price leaked ahead of launch: Here’s what we know so far - CNBCTV18
summary:
iPhone SE 4 price leaked ahead of launch: Here’s what we know so far

Source: CNBC TV18

Apple’s upcoming iPhone SE 4, anticipated to launch in early 2025, is generating buzz due to recent price leaks suggesting a competitive pricing strategy aimed at undercutting its predecessor.

  • The expected launch price of the iPhone SE 4 could be around $500 or lower, according to leaks.
  • It may feature Apple's in-house 5G modem, potentially reducing manufacturing costs.
  • Anticipated specifications include a 6.1-inch OLED display, a 48MP rear camera, and a 24MP front camera.
  • The iPhone SE 4 is expected to adopt USB-C charging ports in compliance with EU regulations.
  • Powered by the A18 processor with 8GB of RAM, it aims to enhance performance and support advanced capabilities.
“This would be the first update to the iPhone SE model since 2022, when Apple added 5G capability to the device.”

title: Juthe Log ": Rohit Sharma And Co. Blasted By Ex-India Star On Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Row - NDTV Sports
summary:
Juthe Log: Rohit Sharma And Co. Blasted By Ex-India Star On Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Row

Publication Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Former Indian cricketer Surinder Khanna criticized the Indian team's performance in the fourth Test against Australia, particularly focusing on Yashasvi Jaiswal's controversial DRS dismissal, which stirred debate about fairness in the game.

  • India lost the match by 184 runs, trailing 2-1 in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.
  • Jaiswal's dismissal was reviewed via DRS with inconclusive evidence.
  • Khanna emphasized the need for fair play and called the team's performance underwhelming.
  • India's point percentage in the World Test Championship has dropped to 52.78.
  • Australia is close to securing a spot in the WTC final, needing just one win from their upcoming matches.
“There is no point in making controversy... you have to play fair wicket first then only you'll start winning.” - Surinder Khanna

India's cricket team faces challenges ahead but can still qualify for the WTC final if they win their last Test against Australia.
newTitle: Juthe Log: Rohit Sharma And Co. Blasted By Ex-India Star On Yashasvi Jaiswal DRS Row

title: Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant and the three shots that sunk India at MCG - The Indian Express
summary:
Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant and the three shots that sunk India at MCG

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Cricket.com.au

In a dramatic final session at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, India lost to Australia by 184 runs, after falling short at 155 while chasing 339. Key players Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Rishabh Pant made critical errors that shifted the game's momentum.

Pat Cummins hailed the win as the “best Test he has been part of”.

  • Rohit Sharma questioned Rishabh Pant's shot selection, emphasizing the need for players to recognize risk percentages.
  • Virat Kohli’s innings ended disappointingly as he chased a wide delivery.
  • The match saw a record attendance of 373,691, the highest for a Test in Australia.

“It’s a sad moment, but not a surprise,” remarked commentator Jim Maxwell on Kohli's dismissal.

India's performance showcased not just individual errors but also a missed opportunity to retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy should they win the next game.
newTitle: India's Defeat at MCG: Key Moments and Critiques

title: Stock market today: Sensex drops 450 points; Nifty50 ends below 23,650 amid global weakness - The Times of India
WhatsApp fights fake news with reverse image search: How to use new feature update - The Financial Express
2024 rewind: Major news events as seen from space - India Today
summary:
2024 Rewind: Major News Events as Seen from Space

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: India Today

As 2024 draws to a close, India Today looks back at the highlights and lowlights of the jam-packed year as seen from space, encompassing domestic and global events.

  • January: Inauguration of Ram Temple in Ayodhya capturing millions' attention.
  • February: Violent protests in Sandeshkhali, West Bengal linked to land grabs and abuse allegations.
  • March: Cargo vessel Dali collided with Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore.
  • April: Severe forest fires in Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh resulted in multiple deaths.
  • June: Construction of a humanitarian aid pier in Gaza, critical amidst ongoing conflict.
  • July: Devastating landslides in Wayanad, Kerala, leading to many fatalities.
  • August: The 2024 Summer Olympics held in Paris, capturing iconic landmarks from space.
  • September: Floods in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana killed numerous individuals, analyzed through satellite data.
  • October: New patrolling arrangement announced between India and China post-border tensions.
  • November: Delay in snowfall at Mount Fuji noted, raising environmental concerns.
  • December: Collapse of Assad's regime in Syria as rebel forces took control of Damascus.
"The initial snowfall on the UNESCO World Heritage site was visible from the southwestern side of the mountain. The absence of snow on Mount Fuji on November 5 broke the previous record for the latest snowfall."

This year has been pivotal, marked by significant events captured from space, underlining the role of satellite technology in understanding global affairs.
newTitle: 2024 Rewind: Major News Events as Seen from Space

title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO opens tomorrow: GMP, price band, issue size among 10 key things to know | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO opens tomorrow: GMP, price band, issue size among 10 key things to know

Date: December 30, 2023

Source: Live Mint

Indo Farm Equipment's initial public offering (IPO) is set to open for public subscription on December 31 and will close on January 2. The company, which manufactures tractors and agricultural equipment, has a grey market premium (GMP) of ₹80 per share.

  • The IPO consists of a fresh issue of 86 lakh equity shares and an offer-for-sale of 35 lakh equity shares.
  • Price band is fixed at ₹204 to ₹215 per equity share.
  • The lot size for the IPO is 69 equity shares.
  • Proceeds will be used for debt repayment, expanding manufacturing capacity, and supporting its NBFC subsidiary.
  • The company aims to offer different portions of the net issue for various types of investors, with 50% to QIBs, 15% to NIIs, and 35% to retail investors.
“Indo Farm with traditional business value and experienced promoters is expected to capitalise over the long run,” said analysts at Anand Rathi.

The IPO is designed to strengthen the company's financial position and support future growth, making it a significant upcoming event in the stock market.
newTitle: Indo Farm Equipment IPO opens tomorrow: GMP, price band, issue size among 10 key things to know

title: Jacob Duffy lands knockout blows to claim 2-0 series lead - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Jacob Duffy lands knockout blows to claim 2-0 series lead

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: ESPN Cricinfo

New Zealand 186 for 5 (Chapman 42, Hay 41, Robinson 41) beat Sri Lanka 141 (Perera 48, Duffy 4-15) by 45 runs.

In a convincing second T20I victory, New Zealand's comprehensive team effort saw them emerge victorious over Sri Lanka, securing a 2-0 series lead.

  • New Zealand set a target of 187 runs for Sri Lanka, who struggled to achieve it, managing only 141 runs.
  • Jacob Duffy's exceptional bowling performance, taking 4 wickets for just 15 runs, played a crucial role in New Zealand's win.
  • Mitchell Hay was named player of the match for his explosive 41 runs off just 19 balls.
  • Sri Lanka's batting woes continued, with their inability to finish innings strongly raising concerns.
  • Key contributors for Sri Lanka included Kusal Perera and Pathum Nissanka, but their efforts were not enough.
  • New Zealand displayed controlled aggression and effective running between the wickets, significantly outpacing Sri Lanka.
“Duffy's 4 for 15 was far and away the best bowling effort, as he provided crucial breakthroughs across Sri Lanka's innings.”

This victory highlights New Zealand's dominance in the series thus far, leaving Sri Lanka searching for answers as they continue to struggle in away conditions.
newTitle: Jacob Duffy Shines as New Zealand Secures 2-0 Lead Against Sri Lanka

title: Law equal for all, I don't blame police: Pawan Kalyan on Allu Arjun's arrest - India Today
summary:
Pawan Kalyan's Stance on Allu Arjun's Arrest and Stampede Incident

Published on: Dec 30, 2024

Andhra Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister and former actor Pawan Kalyan has spoken about the arrest of Telugu actor Allu Arjun in connection with a stampede at a theatre. Kalyan stated that he doesn't blame the police for their actions and that the law is equal for everyone.

Kalyan believes that the incident could have been resolved more easily but was grateful that the police handled it with dignity.

  • Kalyan supports the police's actions in the incident.
  • He understands the excitement of fans but emphasizes the importance of security measures.
  • He praises Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy for his policies.

Kalyan also shares his thoughts on the way the incident was handled and the role of Allu Arjun in the matter.
newTitle: Pawan Kalyan's Stance on Allu Arjun's Arrest and Stampede Incident

Adani Enterprises to exit Adani Wilmar Ltd; AEL to raise over $2 billion - The Hindu
summary:
Adani Enterprises Exits Adani Wilmar Ltd and Raises Over $2 Billion

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Adani Enterprises has signed an agreement with Wilmar International to exit its joint venture with Adani Wilmar Ltd. This move will raise over $2 billion for AEL, through a combination of an OFS (Offer for Sale) and a direct sale to Wilmar.

  • Adani Enterprises is expected to use the proceeds to grow in the core infrastructure businesses.
  • The focus areas include Energy & Utility, Transport & Logistics, and adjacent businesses in Primary Industry.
  • The transaction is anticipated to be completed by March 31, 2025.
“The proceeds will be utilised for growth of AEL in the core infrastructure businesses.”

In conclusion, this strategic exit from Adani Wilmar signals AEL's commitment to strengthening its core operations and positioning for future growth.
newTitle: Adani Enterprises Exits Adani Wilmar Ltd and Raises Over $2 Billion

Rohit Sharma says poor form ‘mentally disturbing’ after India loses Melbourne Test - The Hindu
summary:
Rohit Sharma Calls Poor Form 'Mentally Disturbing' After Australia's Victory in Fourth Test

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

After India's defeat against Australia in the fourth Test, captain Rohit Sharma expressed his disappointment over the team's performance and acknowledged the mental toll it has taken on him.

  • India lost the fourth Test against Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
  • Rohit mentioned that the team had opportunities to draw the game but failed to capitalize.
  • He described his struggles as a batter, stating that many things are not falling into place and that it is 'mentally disturbing.'
  • Looking forward, Rohit emphasized the importance of playing well in the upcoming match in Sydney to aim for a series draw.
  • He addressed questions about Rishabh Pant's dismissals and the management of Jasprit Bumrah's bowling workload.
  • Rohit praised the performance of Nitish Kumar and recognized the hard work of Mohammed Siraj and Akash Deep.
“Obviously, few results have not gone our way and as a captain, it is disappointing. As a batter, a lot of the things I am trying to do are not falling in place. Mentally, look, it is disturbing.”

Rohit's insights reflect the challenges faced by the Indian team and highlight the mental aspects of performance in competitive sports.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma Calls Poor Form 'Mentally Disturbing' After Australia's Victory in Fourth Test

title: Study of matrix modifications by nano-clay on the mechanical properties of AA3003 honeycomb sandwich panels - Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham
Adani Enterprises to fully exit Adani Wilmar Ltd - The Economic Times
"Third Umpire Did Make...": On Yashasvi Jaiswal Controversy, Simon Taufel's Blunt Verdict - NDTV Sports
Adani Enterprises to fully exit Adani Wilmar JV; check details here | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Adani Enterprises to Fully Exit Adani Wilmar Joint Venture

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

Adani Enterprises has announced its decision to completely exit the consumer goods joint venture with Wilmar International, known as Adani Wilmar. The process will occur in two phases, starting with a substantial share acquisition by Wilmar.

  • Adani Enterprises holds a 44% stake in Adani Wilmar.
  • Wilmar will acquire 31.06% of equity shares from Adani Commodities at ₹305 per share.
  • Adani Enterprises will also sell an additional ~13% of shares to comply with public shareholding requirements.
  • Directors from Adani Enterprises will resign from Adani Wilmar's board.
  • Both companies will collaborate to rename Adani Wilmar ahead of transaction completion.
“Adani Enterprises, Adani Commodities LLP and Lence Pte Ltd have entered into an agreement… whereby Lence will acquire all the paid-up equity shares of Adani Wilmar held by ACL.”

Following the announcement, Adani Enterprises shares rose by 7.65%, while Adani Wilmar shares experienced volatility but ended nearly flat.

Adani Enterprises aims to reinvest generated funds into core operations including energy, transport, and logistics.
newTitle: Adani Enterprises to Fully Exit Adani Wilmar Joint Venture

title: Rahul Gandhi exploited Manmohan Singh’s death for his expedient politics: BJP - The Hindu
summary:
BJP Accuses Rahul Gandhi of Exploiting Manmohan Singh’s Death for Political Gain

Publication Date: December 30, 2024
Source: The Hindu

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) launched a strong criticism of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, alleging he exploited the death of former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh for political purposes while vacationing in Vietnam.

  • BJP claims Rahul Gandhi exploited Dr. Singh's death for his own political advantage.
  • Congress criticized the BJP for diverting attention from key issues of governance.
  • BJP's Amit Malviya accused Gandhi of showing contempt for Singh and recalled historical grievances.
  • Congress leader Manickam Tagore rebuked the BJP, highlighting the shameful treatment of Singh's family.
“Mr. Gandhi politicised and exploited Dr. Singh’s death for his expedient politics but his contempt for him is unmissable.” - Amit Malviya, BJP IT cell head

The political confrontation underscores the contentious atmosphere surrounding the legacy of Dr. Singh in Indian politics and highlights ongoing party rivalries.
newTitle: BJP Accuses Rahul Gandhi of Exploiting Manmohan Singh’s Death for Political Gain

title: Will GTA 6 Be Delayed? Here's How Rockstar-Owner Take Two Still Offers Hope For 2025 Release - ABP Live
summary:
GTA 6 Release Timeline: Take-Two Confirms 2025 Launch, Hypes Upcoming Titles

Publication Date: Article Publish Date, Source: Abplive

GTA fans worldwide awaited the GTA 6 trailer on December 27, but it didn't materialize. However, Take-Two Interactive, Rockstar Games' parent company, has reassured fans that GTA 6 will indeed release in the fall of 2025.

Key Points

  • GTA 6 is confirmed to release in Q3/Q4 2025
  • Take-Two expects GTA 6 to set new industry benchmarks, following the success of GTA V (205 million copies) and Red Dead Redemption 2 (62 million copies)
  • Upcoming Take-Two titles include Civilization 7, WWE 2K25, Borderlands 4, and Mafia: The Old Country

Notable Quote

Strauss Zelnick, CEO of Take-Two Interactive: "With many exciting new titles coming in Fiscal 2026 – including Grand Theft Auto VI, Borderlands 4, and Mafia: The Old Country – we expect to create long-term value for our shareholders."
newTitle: GTA 6 Release Timeline: Take-Two Confirms 2025 Launch, Hypes Upcoming Titles

title: Soon, WhatsApp web will allow reverse image search through Google: Details - Business Standard
summary:
WhatsApp Web to Introduce Reverse Image Search via Google

Date & Source: Dec 30 2024 | 3:00 PM IST, Business Standard

Meta is reportedly working with Google to tackle misinformation on WhatsApp. The reverse image search feature, first tested on Android, is now being explored for the WhatsApp web client. This feature will allow users to search an image on the web using Google, helping them gather more context and determine if the image has been manipulated. The feature is expected to be available soon on both WhatsApp Android app and WhatsApp Web.

  • The feature will allow users to upload a photo to Google to perform a reverse image search.
  • It is expected to be available on both WhatsApp Android app and WhatsApp Web in the coming weeks.
  • The feature is akin to Google's existing reverse image search but more convenient as it's integrated within WhatsApp.
While Meta has not officially confirmed the availability of the new reverse image search feature, it is expected to be available soon.

Source: Business Standard
newTitle: WhatsApp Web to Introduce Reverse Image Search via Google

title: Govt starts countervailing duty probe on Vietnamese chemical | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
India Initiates Countervailing Duty Probe on Subsidized Vietnamese Chemical Imports

New Delhi, Dec 30 (PTI)

India has started a countervailing duty investigation into increased imports of Calcium Carbonate Filler Masterbatch, a chemical used in the plastic industry, from Vietnam. The move follows a complaint from domestic manufacturers who allege that the increased imports are subsidized, causing material injury to their businesses.

  • The Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) has initiated the probe.
  • Domestic manufacturers have alleged that producers/exporters in Vietnam have received actionable subsidies from various levels of the Vietnamese government.
  • Countervailing duties are country-specific duties imposed to safeguard domestic industries against unfair trade subsidies.
"On the basis of the duly substantiated written application filed by the domestic industry...on the basis of the prima facie evidence submitted by the domestic industry, about the subsidization of the product...the authority, hereby, initiates an investigation."

Vietnam is a key trading partner of India, with exports and imports reaching USD 5.47 billion and USD 9.34 billion respectively in 2023-24.
newTitle: India Initiates Countervailing Duty Probe on Subsidized Vietnamese Chemical Imports

title: Pushpa 2 Worldwide Box Office (25 Days): Allu Arjun's Magnum Opus Is Just 19.53 Crores Away From Achieving A Big Milestone - Koimoi
summary:
Pushpa 2 Worldwide Box Office: Allu Arjun's Magnum Opus Nears 1700 Crores

Date & Source: December 25, 2023, Koimoi

Introduction: Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' continues its dominant run at the box office, nearing a significant milestone.

  1. Earned 39.20 crore net in India during the fourth weekend.
  2. Total Indian box office collection stands at 1179.85 crore net (1392.22 crore gross).
  3. Overseas collection reached 288.25 crore gross, making the worldwide total 1680.47 crore gross.
  4. Needs only 19.53 crore to enter the 1700-crore club.
Pushpa 2 has had a historic run so far, and very soon, it will unleash one significant milestone: a score of 1700 crores at the worldwide box office.

Conclusion: 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' is set to achieve another major milestone in the coming days, cementing its status as one of the biggest blockbusters in recent times.
newTitle: Pushpa 2: A Box Office Phenomenon

title: WhatsApp Web to get reverse image search feature soon to help users identify fake photos - Moneycontrol
summary:
WhatsApp Web to get reverse image search feature soon to help users identify fake photos

Date: December 30, 2024 / Source: Moneycontrol

WhatsApp is introducing a new reverse image search feature to tackle the spread of fake information. This will allow WhatsApp users to authenticate received images via Google and provide a more reliable way to judge the authenticity of shared images.

  • Meta plans to help users identify fake photos on WhatsApp using reverse image search.
  • Users can tap any image in a chat to initiate a reverse image search.
  • The 'Search on the web' option will be available in the three-dot menu for selected images.
  • This feature was previously spotted in the Android beta application.
  • Google's database will help verify the authenticity of shared images.
"The popular messaging platform WhatsApp has often been used for escalating various fake or misleading information across its millions of users."

This new feature aims to combat the spread of misinformation and help users verify the images they receive.
newTitle: WhatsApp Web to Introduce Reverse Image Search Feature Soon
